content.description: Same as Woody's Arete, but sit start!
content.location: See Woody's Arete

content.description: Stand-start and follow the brilliant arete to the top. A super classic! Also known as Bastard's Edge.
content.location: Located on the Ceiling Block, (opposite corner from where you walk in).  The Ceiling Block is the next block past the Tendon Repair Kit Block is the first big obvious boulder on the left which faces the same direction as the trail when walking in.

content.description: Start standing using a jug just right of the arete under the roof. Move out the roof and along a jug horizontal, through a couple of pinch pockets or crimp ledges to a good sloper on the arete. Find your feet and make a long move up to a horizontal. Use "the wheel" and topout. Any blocks, boulders or rocks that are not a part of the main boulder are off.
content.protection: To properly protect this you should have a few pads and at least 2 spotters.
content.location: The first freestanding decently sized climbable boulder that you come to going straight as you exit the Mr. Clean Corridor.

content.description: Climb the wide dihedral crack to the top where you will discover the reason for it's name.
content.protection: Medium to large cams or toprope from tree anchor
content.location: Located in the large corridor behind and to the left of the Ceiling Block, it is the wide dihedral crack on the right wall.

content.description: Yeah, don't fall.  Also note, this is the down climb also.
content.protection: Good hand grips.  Don't fall broski
content.location: The east face of the ceiling block.

content.description:
An instant classic in the Cooper's Rock Area and a stroke of genius by the setter, this route will send you into a debaucherous fit of ecstacy from the start and is a great warm-up for the area (it really gets the blood pumping to your fingertips). Find the big pocket ~2 ft off the ground in the middle of the face right of Woody's Arete. Using no hands, step up into the pocket. This problem is complete when you have successfully stood balanced in the pocket using no hands.

Note: This route can still be climbed in an absolute downpour

This route is #7a on Boulder 1: Ceiling in the Ceiling Block Area in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon Guidebook.
content.location: Find the big pocket in the middle of the Ceiling block face that is facing the closest parking area/Mr. Clean Corridor and is opposite the trailside face.

content.description: Stand start with an undercling and a small hold up to the right. Smear up to generous slopers and sloping crimps. Continue to the jug slot at the bottom of the roof, match to end the problem, then downclimb.
content.location: This line goes up the right side of the Ceiling Block face. Green line on the topo.

content.description: Climb the face just left of Mister Clean avoiding the crack entirely.
content.location: Just to the left of Mister Clean in the Mister Clean Corridor.

content.description: A short but nice crack climb with a few handholds and pockets mixed in. It tends to be a bit more difficult than it looks. Also, the tree right at the top of the crack makes setting it up on toprope very easy.
content.location: The obvious crack in the middle of the Mister Clean Corridor.

content.description: Stand start on opposing gastons. Move up and right to three usually damp and rather sharp flat crimps. Use thin footholds to bump up to a crimpy gaston, then use more gritty crimps to reach the bottom of the roof. The seam between the roof and the boulder is the ending jug. Either try to downclimb the problem, or bring enough pads to jump.
content.location: This line goes up the left side of the Ceiling Block face, between Woody's Arete and Ball's Out. Mint green on the topo.

content.description:
Stand start using a vertical seam and sloper. Climb straight up using a pocket and various other holds to reach a left hand gaston. Move upward to a sloping jug to finish. Avoid the letterbox jug to the right at the beginning of the climb.

- V2 Variation: Start on the same vertical seam and sloper and move right to the letterbox jug. Climb up and slightly right through slopers and an undercling to finish at a set of jugs.
content.location: Start approximately 5 feet right of the arete and Ain’t No Leaner at a 3" wide vertical seam. Located on the side of the Ceiling Block facing the river.

content.description: Climb the face just to the right of Mister Clean avoiding the crack entirely.
content.location: Just to the right of Mister Clean in the Mister Clean Corridor

content.description: Stand start with good smears and small sloping crimps. Grab the left facing sidepull and crank up to a dark sloper. Continue up to several larger slopers and sloping crimps to reach the slot jug below the roof. Downclimbing is the only way back down.
content.protection: Three pads minimum. The landing is rather bad on this one.
content.location: This line goes up the center of the Ceiling Block face, right of Ball's Out. Pink on the topo.

content.description: Stand start just left of the right arete. A right palm press may help you start. Continue up the slab using crystal covered smears and slopers until you can touch the ceiling. Make sure you are comfortable downclimbing each move as you go up, because that is the only way down.
content.location: This line goes up the right side of the Ceiling Block face. Yellow on the topo.

content.description: Stand start with your left hand in the large obvious jug pocket. A right crimp sidepull will help you balance as you smear up to the flat slab jug. Walk up more flat sloping edges to the roof and end matched in the slot jug. This line may be the easiest to downclimb, which is required to get down.
content.location: This line goes up the center side of the Ceiling Block face. Light blue on the topo.

content.description: Climb the obvious rounded hand crack on the Ceiling Block to the top. Rappel from the tree to get down.
content.location: On the East face of the Ceiling Block to the left of Woody's Arete.

content.description: Sit start on a low jug and follow edges up the overhanging face while avoiding the left arete.
content.location: Located in the Mister Clean Corridor on the boulder across from the Mister Clean Crack.

content.description: This is a "must do" if you love highball slabs. Establish using the huge pocket. Move straight up through crimps, then find the two imaginary footholds. Use an undercling adjacent to the larger crimps and a tiny sloping crimp slightly below the bulgey pinch/ undercling feature and fully weight the toe-nub. Pray your rubber sticks and grab the big sidepull and stand on the good crimps then finish matched in the slot below the roof. Either down climb the route or traverse left and find an easier downclimb.
content.protection: Two pads at least. There is a big rock to donk your noggin on if you fall precariously.
content.location:
The problem starts on the same hole as Spiderwoman Problem in the center of the Ceiling Block.

Red on the topo.

This route is #7 on Boulder 1: Ceiling in the Ceiling Block Area in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon Guidebook.

content.description:
Start standing using anything you can find on the left lip of the arete and a pocket on the right for hands. Get balancy feet and make moves through crimp pockets on the thin horizontal, move up to the second large angled horizontal and finish on the jug horizontal above that.

This route is #2 on Boulder 1: Ceiling in the Ceiling Block Area in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon Guidebook.
content.protection: If you only have one pad, pad the flat rock underneath the climb as you will most likely fall on that. You shouldn't fall in the crack between the flat rock and the climb unless you are really unlucky. Also, above the end jug appears to be a line of jugs to the top. You probably shouldn't top out through these without an exit strategy as there is no good retreat from the top of this boulder.
content.location: Approaching from the Warm-Up boulders parking area through the trail this is the first arete you come to trailside on this boulder. This boulder is just beyond The Fin boulder in the Tendon Repair Kit Area and creates a corridor between the two boulders.

content.description: Stand start with a right hand two finger sharp pocket. Crank on it and some sloping crimps to smear up to a few larger gritty slopers. A right sloping mono sidepull pocket may help you balance and you stand up to more gritty smears. Continue smearing up to the roof, then downclimb. This one is rather tall, thin, and mean.
content.location: This line goes up the right side of the Ceiling Block face, left of Ceiling Press. Dark Lavender on the topo.
